climbs.name: Sitting on the couch eating cheetos

content.description: Good warm up for the area. Still dirty in some spots. If you try to grab in the large hole you may be surprised with a face full of dirt (I don't think there are any holds in there anyways).
content.protection: 4 bolts and cold shuts up top.
content.location: Route with the large hole up top with orange streak below.

content.description: Super fun overhung route, cruxes at the middle and before the anchors. You can rest a bit at the last bolt. Bottom still needs some cleaning before the first bolt.
content.location: Just to the left of Sitting on the couch eating cheetos.

content.description: This climb is set up for teaching lead climbs and cleaning of route. It is an over Bolted route to help experienced climbers instruct on the basics of lead belaying.  If you stay to the left of the bolt line it is about a 5.7, but if you go into the dihedral it is closer to a 5.5 or 5.6.  The crux is when you are standing on the ledge with a blank face just before going onto the 45 degree slanted slab.  There are 3 anchors at the top to allow someone to go up and tie off for instructing others on how to clean a route.
content.location: Located 20 feet down from the 5.9 - Sitting on the couch eating cheitos

content.description: Fun moves to mostly big holds, gets more overhung at the top, hidden hold at the anchors that feels oh so good. The bottom still needs some cleaning- just watch what you grab lower, after the second bolt everything is solid.
Short little beauty in the Ditch
content.location: Furthest left route in Redbird Canyon

content.description: Climbs up bolted crack to slight overhang up top.
content.protection: Well protected with 4 bolts but was originally climbed with gear. Chains up top. Good place to learn placing gear.

content.description: Starts on big holds down low and just keeps getting steeper and the hold get smaller up top. Open project- 5.12 rating is a guess, let me know if you send it.
content.location: Most overhung route in the area at the current time.

content.description: Fun vertical route, still a bit dirty and sharp in some spots.
content.location: Route to the left of Crickety Crack

content.description: Nice little limestone crag off the beaten path. Routes are on the short side but tend to be pretty powerful. Most routes just put up in 2015.  Main amphitheater area stays in the shade until about 1pm (Summer/Fall). It is a ways off the highway so you usually have the place to yourself. There is a route just as you enter the area- if anyone knows the FA and grade let me know and I will put it up.
